channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Travel agent welcomes government support package
item.description: A support package for travel agents will keep them afloat so they can recoup the costs of cancelled holidays, a tourism business boss says.

item.title: NCEA changes for students' credit earning system
item.description: The government announced changes that build on the system of bonus credits previously announced for all students.

item.title: Covid-19: Six new cases in NZ today, four in community
item.description: There are six new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, four in the community and two in managed isolation.

item.title: Rise in scam call complaints, tens of thousands of dollars lost
item.description: Police are warning people to be vigilant about scam calls following a rise in complaints which have seen some victims losing tens of thousands of dollars.

item.title: Officers wrong to punch man, IPCA says
item.description: The Independent Police Conduct Authority has found an unnamed officer was wrong to punch a man during a roadside search and says the search of the victim should have been better-planned and reported.

item.title: Covid turmoil stops parents reaching overseas surrogate babies
item.description: Families with surrogate babies being born overseas are struggling to collect them because of international border restrictions and pandemic turmoil.

item.title: Surge in positive Covid-19 cases returning to NZ from India
item.description: In the last fortnight, 26 people have tested positive after returning from India, largely off just two flights.

item.title: Attorney-General's report says proposed drug-driving laws will contravene Bill of Rights
item.description: The Attorney-General believes proposed drug-driving laws will trample all over the Bill of Rights.

item.title: Iwi faces tricky balancing act in upgrading Swiss Alpine style lodge
item.description: A South Taranaki iwi is wrestling with a nice to have problem - how to spend $3 million in government funding.

item.title: Prisoners to get employment with KiwiRail in Northland
item.description: Dozens of prisoners will assist with railway maintenance work in Northland after Regional Economic Development Minister Shane Jones announced $640,000 worth of funding for the "Second Steppers" programme.

item.title: Warning Christchurch Hospital funding woes will put pressure on ICU and elective surgery
item.description: The head of intensive care at Christchurch Hospital is warning some surgery for children and adults will have to be put off because of funding woes.

item.title: Thousands of port workers won't need Covid-19 tests
item.description: Thousands of Ports of Auckland workers are exempt from compulsory Covid-19 border testing, because they are not considered high risk.

item.title: Call for Tauranga council's elected members to be sacked and fresh elections to be held
item.description: It follows the Tauranga City Council approving a budget of up to $350,000 to fund an independent team tasked with sorting out in-fighting among elected members.

item.title: Truckers demand billion-dollar spend to fix 'dilapidated' roads
item.description: Truckers are finding shock absorbers torn from trailers and steering joints failing more often and blame the worsening state of highways.

item.title: Woman finally gets Work and Income back payment for decades old retirement error
item.description: A woman has got a more than $4000 back payment from Work and Income, after a mistake was made when she was applying for the benefit more than two decades ago.

item.title: Watch: Guide to using and storing Covid-19 face masks
item.description: It may seem straightforward to put on a mask - but many of us are overlooking the basics, such as not washing hands before and after use, and the correct storage method.

item.title: Japan to resume search for crew of capsized cattle ship
item.description: Japan's coastguard says an aircraft and two patrol boats will resume the search for missing crew members, including two New Zealanders, from the capsized cattle ship.

item.title: Arrest after spate of Christchurch fires
item.description: Police have arrested a man in relation to fires at two Christchurch churches and a cafe.
